Example.BHC Span: Sodium did correct after IVH. On admission 122; improved after receiving 1L NS to Na 139.
Example.AVS Span: Your sodium levels improved with intravenous fluids.

Example.BHC Span: Patient orthostatic on hospital day 2, so likely hypovolemia hyponatremia secondary to low solute from alcohol abuse.
Example.AVS Span: The cause of your hyponatremia was initially unclear, but it was likely due to low solute from alcohol abuse and dehydration.

Example.BHC Span: Patient has h/o ETOH abuse but no h/o seizures from withdrawal in past (although she is a poor historian).
Example.AVS Span: You have a history of alcohol abuse, but you have not had seizures from withdrawal in the past.

Example.BHC Span: Thiamine, folate, MVI PO given daily.
Example.AVS Span: During your hospital stay, you were monitored for alcohol withdrawal symptoms and received thiamine, folate, and multivitamins.
Your sodium levels improved with intravenous fluids, and you did not have any further episodes of low blood pressure or orthostatic symptoms.
You underwent a CT scan of your head, which was normal.
